content: Examining the DB of a test Backdrop site, I see the variable table, though empty. Do we still need this table since all the variables (previously (d7) stored there) have been moved to either configuration files or state table? If yes, then for what purposes?
It's for compatibility purposes, although deprecated. Mainly to make upgrades from D7 easier.
I wonder if it doesn't get created if you set Drupal compatibility off in settings.php
@Herb I don't think so. This table simply gets installed via system_schema(), no conditions. It's just usually empty - and doesn't hurt anyone. :wink:
